scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In letters to a Mrs. Carr, and a Miss Ellis, Trowbridge complains that artists often do not read a story carefully before illustrating it, includes a humorous drawing about his illegible hand and supplies information on some art lectures by Francis Hopkinson Smith.

did.unittitle: John T. Trowbridge to Mrs. Carr 1882 Mar 29

scopecontent.p: [Responds to her letter asking about their intentions of returning to Bar Harbor and Mt. Desert, Maine, with Mrs. Gilman and Mr. Higgins, by expressing concerns about the climate upon Alice [Trowbridge ?], and including a humorous drawing of Mr. Higgins, his neighbors, and the postmaster all trying to decipher Trowbridge's handwriting]
